mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Anna Cora Ritchie to Ann Pamela Cunningham, 1858 August 12
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Ritchie, Anna Cora Mowatt (1819-1870)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Anna Cora Ritchie, Vice Regent for Virginia, to Ann Pamela Cunningham, August 12, 1858. Largely regarding appointments of Vice Regents. Best advisers say facts rather than a defense of John Augustine Washington should be given. Sent the Vice Regents Miss Hamilton's system, has distributed Mount Vernon Records. She does not consent to publication of her letter re Miss Hamilton, but an article may be written by Christie Johnson from this letter. Discusses Miss Hamilton's constant efforts for Mount Vernon. Disapproves Regent's wish to open an office in Philadelphia. Reports activity of workers in Astoria and Ravenswood. Mrs. Ritchie's father criticizes order of reporting Vice Regentsâ€™ names. Refers to letter re salary.
